3/5/2022, updated on 28/12/2024: TINDAKMALAYSIA NETWORK SERVICES PLT (TINDAK MALAYSIA)

Election Commission of Malaysia (SPR), Tindak Malaysia (2020), Florczyk A.J., Corbane C., Ehrlich D., Freire S., Kemper T., Maffenini L., Melchiorri M., Pesaresi M., Politis P., Schiavina, M., Sabo F., Zanchetta L., GHSL Data Package 2019, EUR 29788 EN, Publications Office of the European Union, Luxembourg, 2019, ISBN 978-92-76-13186-1, doi:10.2760/290498, JRC 117104, WorldPop (www.worldpop.org - School of Geography and Environmental Science, University of Southampton; Department of Geography and Geosciences, University of Louisville; Departement de Geographie, Universite de Namur) and Center for International Earth Science Information Network (CIESIN), Columbia University (2018). Global High Resolution Population Denominators Project - Funded by The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation (OPP1134076). https://dx.doi.org/10.5258/SOTON/WP00675

Tindak Malaysia calculates all the percentages for electoral demographics. There is no official ethnic demographic data. The percentages for electoral demographics may not attain exactly 100%, but the variation is kept below 2%. Malay Electors are clumped together under the Muslim Bumiputera community. Bumiputera Sarawak community would have been classified as Others, Non-Muslim Bumiputera, and Muslim Bumiputera category. Orang Kurang Upaya (OKU) or People with Disabilities (PWD) count is estimated. Age groups are based on the age of the voters as of 31/12/2020. TindakMalaysia Network Services PLT is not responsible for any errors or omissions arising from the original data or its derivatives
